result.execSummary:
The defendant Austin M Fehrm was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Armed Robbery [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime, Repeater], a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: THE DEPARTMENT OF CORRECTIONS SHALL DEDUCT RESTITUTION AND ALL OTHER COURT OBLIGATIONS AT THE RATE OF 25% OF ALL MONIES RECEIVED WHILE INCARCERATED.  ------------------------------

superMiscConds.notes:
Pay court costs and Department of Corrections Supervision Fees.  If the defendant is discharged from Extended Supervision with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment may be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.
---------------------------

No contact with the victim(s) without the victim's and Agent's consent.
---------------------------

Counseling as recommended by Probation Agent.  Provide biological specimen to state crime lab for DNA analysis, and pay DNA analysis surcharge.
---------------------------
Restitution is to be determined and shall be joint and several with co-actor.

Defendant Austin M Fehrm in court, in custody with attorney Peter Wilson.  Joshua P Grube appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Minutes filed. Preliminary hearing requested within time period.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 9, 2014 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Austin M Fehrm in court, in custody.  Diane M Donohoo appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant does not have attorney. Matter reset for defendant to contact Public Defender's Office.  Minutes filed.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for May 7, 2014 at 01:15 pm.

Defendant Austin M Fehrm in court, in custody with attorney David A Danz Specially.  Diane M Donohoo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Minutes filed. Preliminary hearing requested within time period.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 2, 2014 at 03:00 pm.
Signed bond filed with the court.

Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol.  Defendant shall not drive a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license.  Defendant will not possess any guns or other weapons.  Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH VICTIM A.G.T., NO CONTACT WITH WITNESS W.G., NO CONTACT WITH CO-ACTOR F.S.  Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.
Defendant appears in court, in custody, with attorney David Danz specially. Haley Rea appears for the State of Wisconsin. Minutes filed.
